content: Singaporean parliamentary meeting The **6th Parliament of Singapore** was a meeting of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). Its first session commenced on 25 February 1985 and was prorogued on 27 January 1986. It commenced its second session on 20 February 1986 and was dissolved on 17 August 1988. The members of the 6th Parliament were elected in the [1984 general election](/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election). Parliament was controlled by a [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) majority, led by [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister) [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) and his [Cabinet](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore). The Speaker was Dr [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng). The *de facto* [Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)) was [J. B. Jeyaretnam](/wiki/J._B._Jeyaretnam) of the [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) until he lost his parliamentary seat following his convictions, and was replaced by [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) of the [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party). The sixth Parliament saw the presence of women lawmakers for the first time in 14 years since (/wiki/1970_Singaporean_by-elections). Two seats were vacated in 1986 and remained vacated until the end of term, with Jeyaretnam being the first, followed by [Geylang West](/wiki/Geylang_West_Single_Member_Constituency)'s MP [Teh Cheang Wan](/wiki/Teh_Cheang_Wan) who committed suicide over corruption; with Jeyaretnam's vacation, this was the last instance where only two parties represented the Parliament until (/wiki/13th_Parliament_of_Singapore). ## Officeholders - [**Speaker**](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore)**:** [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Deputy Speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore#List_of_deputy_speakers):** [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 1 March 1985 - **[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore):** [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Deputy Prime Minister**](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)**:** - [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Leader of the Opposition**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore))**:** - [J. B. Jeyaretnam](/wiki/J._B._Jeyaretnam) ([WP](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))), until 10 November 1986 - [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) ([SDP](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)), from 10 November 1986 - [**Leader of the House**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_House_(Singapore))**:** - [S. Dhanabalan](/wiki/S._Dhanabalan) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), until 24 February 1987 - [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 25 February 1987 - **[Party Whip of the People's Action Party](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party):** Lee Yiok Seng - [**Deputy Party Whip of the People's Action Party**](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party#List_of_deputy_party_whips)**:** - [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong), until 27 January 1987 - Eugene Yap, from 28 January 1987 ## Composition Political partyMembersAt [election](/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election)At dissolution[People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)77**76**[Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))1**0**[Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)1**1**Vacant seats1**3****Total**80**80****Government majority**75**75** ## Members ConstituencyMemberParty[Alexandra](/wiki/Alexandra_Constituency)[**Tan** Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon)[People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Aljunied](/wiki/Aljunied_Constituency)[**Chin** Harn Tong](/wiki/Chin_Harn_Tong)[People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Ang Mo Kio](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_Single_Member_Constituency)[**Yeo** Toon Chia](/wiki/Yeo_Toon_Chia)[People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Anson](/wiki/Anson_Constituency)[J.
